title: AbstractHonoClient#createReceiver: closeHook called after resultFuture has already failed
body:
We tried to create a consumer via the HonoClient and got the following log output:

>  15:38:01.368 [vert.x-eventloop-thread-3] DEBUG o.e.h.client.impl.AbstractHonoClient - receiver open attach failed [Source{address='null', durable=NONE, expiryPolicy=SESSION_END, timeout=0, dynamic=false, dynamicNodeProperties=null, distributionMode=null, filter=null, defaultOutcome=null, outcomes=null, capabilities=null}] by peer [Router.qdrouterd-b7c5bd887-4khf2]: Error{condition=amqp:unauthorized-access, description='link disallowed by local policy', info=null}
>  
>  15:38:01.369 [vert.x-eventloop-thread-3] DEBUG o.e.h.client.impl.AbstractHonoClient - receiver [event/HEALTH_CHECK_TENANT] closed by peer [Router.qdrouterd-b7c5bd887-4khf2]: Error{condition=amqp:unauthorized-access, description='link disallowed by local policy', info=null}

That means the result Future of the `AbstractHonoClient#createReceiver` invocation failed. 
The unexpected part was that afterwards, the closeHandler got called as well.

The same way as a failed `honoClient.connect` attempt only fails the returned Future - and does not trigger the disconnect Handler, IMHO a failed `createReceiver` invocation should only fail the returned Future and should not trigger the closeHandler as well (even if a "close" was received).
